txt.en: Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
The Tale of Théodwyne Sternbrow
Frúma
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Cendric the Worthy

'All hope for the Éothéod rested now on the shoulders of Théodwyne Sternbrow. There are few stories of Théodwyne, but the ones that do exist are powerful tales. She was the first, and to my knowledge the only, woman to rule the Éothéod. It is safe to surmise that Théodwyne did not have the support of all the thanes. Let us see what we can find at Framsburg to piece together this tale.'
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Hlithseld is located in the north of Misthallow.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Hlithseld.
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Continue learning the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Further learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Hlithseld is located in the north of Misthallow.\n\nYou should travel to Hlithseld and rest.
'Numerous attempts were made either to depose Théodwyne Sternbrow or, failing that, to wed her.'
Éothéod
'I have not come to kill you! I have come to wed you, my love!'
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
'Begone with you!'
Return to Hlithseld to rest
'Théodwyne did take a husband in time, and soon after bore a son, Frúma.'
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Framsburg.
'Frúma became lord at sixteen, though he shared power with his mother for nearly twenty years, until her death.'
Talk to Léothred at Hlithseld
'My people will go far.'
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Framsburg.
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
'There are few stories of Théodwyne, but the ones that do exist are powerful tales.'
'Frúma died while hunting in the Misty Mountains.'
Talk to Léothred elsewhere at Framsburg
'Cendric the Worthy proved an exceptional lord, both a mighty warrior and a noble ruler.'
'Cendric let it be known that the Éothéod had need of broader fields in which to roam.'
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Talk to Léothred elsewhere at Framsburg
Léothred, the Rohirric scholar, seeks to learn more of his people history in Misthallow.

'The legacy of Théodwyne Sternbrow was a seed planted, and that seed came to bear fruit near the end of Cendric's rule. There, Cendric let it be known that the Éothéod had need of broader fields in which to roam. He even discussed with Cirion, Steward of Gondor, the possibility of finding land somewhere in the south.\n\n'Let us rest. Then we shall continue to explore this history.'

'Frúma died while hunting in the Misty Mountains. His broken body was found frozen at the floor of a ravine several months after his death. Some said he was killed by a giant, others said that he fell in a winter storm.'

'Frúma's son Cendric succeeded him while he was still young. Cendric the Worthy proved an exceptional lord, both a mighty warrior and a noble ruler, and was also blessed with a lengthy reign of peace and plenty. When he died at age seventy-nine, having ruled for fifty-seven years, the Éothéod were more prosperous than ever before. Their numbers were beginning to grow too great for the Wells to support.'
